metadata.synopsis: After Minsc is rescued from the Absolute's domination, he and Jaheira have a brief confrontation at camp. They were the first to discover the cult, and Jaheira believes they might have ended the threat that night if Minsc had not charged in and been captured. The player can agree with Jaheira, or offer a counterpoint - that Minsc only did what he thought was right, and it set the course of events that eventually led you all to join forces.
metadata.how_to_trigger: The first long rest when Minsc and Jaheira have been recrutied

12.speaker: Minsc
12.text: Jaheira... Boo is trying his best to explain, but I still do not understand your anger.
12.context: NodeContext: Hesitant, a little apologetic - wants to get it but doesn't

23.speaker: Jaheira
23.text: Do not hide behind your hamster, ranger. You do not understand, because you do not listen.

0.speaker: Jaheira
0.text: We were the first to discover the cult. And if you had only waited, we might have marshalled our numbers and -

11.speaker: Minsc
11.text: Good does not wait for evil to button up its britches - when it offers buttocks for the smacking, Minsc and Boo greet cheek with hand!
11.context: NodeContext: Quietly scandalised at the notion that he should have stopped and waited for reinforcements, rather than wading into incredible odds alone.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: That sounds like a fun evening.

39.speaker: Minsc
39.text: It is well that Boo's innocent ears still ring from all this shouting.
39.context: NodeContext: A little offended - the player is being inappropriate in front of his hamster

13.speaker: Jaheira
13.text: I would like to see if a lesson has been learned.

25.speaker: Jaheira
25.text: This mess falls on our heads, Minsc. The city under siege - its people poisoned by the cult - it all might have been avoided if you had just put your feelings aside and listened.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: You are the only one Minsc listens to - remember?

19.speaker: Jaheira
19.text: You mean the doppelgangers? It is no comfort to me that my face made this fool all the easier to lead. The point remains.

20.speaker: Jaheira
20.text: On that point, I am still to be convinced.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Or the trail would have ended there, instead of leading you to Ketheric. The Prism. Me.

3.speaker: Jaheira
3.text: I have seen too much to believe destiny has taken our side. Blind luck, perhaps. The point remains.

27.speaker: Jaheira
27.text: You meant well, Minsc. But you exposed the city to harm. You helped the cult spread. And worse, perhaps, than any of this:

44.speaker: Jaheira
44.text: You forced me to leave you behind.

17.speaker: Minsc
17.text: But... this is where Minsc falls short of the understanding, Jaheira.
17.context: NodeContext: Puzzled - a little wary to contradict Jaheira but working it out

28.speaker: Minsc
28.text: What else is a berserker for, if not to charge into danger ahead of his Wychlaran?
28.context: NodeContext: Genuinely bemused. He would happily throw away his life to protect Jaheira, and takes it for granted that she knows this 'Wick-LAR-an' - means wise woman / good witch in his homeland

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *The Wychlaran: wise women of Rashemen, each bonded to a berserker bodyguard for life. There is no higher title, nor deeper bond, in all of Rashemaar custom.*

4.speaker: Jaheira
4.text: Wychlaran...? Minsc, I am not your witch. You are not my bodyguard. This is not some high lodge of your homeland.

29.speaker: Minsc
29.text: Boo agrees, you are a queer kind of witch. But this city is a queer place. And Minsc, you may have noticed, is sometimes strange himself.
29.context: NodeContext: Tone is "I know it's strange, I agree, but hear me out"

9.speaker: Minsc
9.text: The titles matter not. Only this - when Minsc does as Minsc does, and charges in to make a mess:
9.context: NodeContext: Brushing aside Jaheira's discomfort with the title of 'wychlaran', getting to the point of what he means

7.speaker: Minsc
7.text: Jaheira does as Jaheira does, and finds a way to save us all anyway.
7.context: NodeContext: Absolute unshakeable faith that Jaheira can and will solve any problem

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Aw. That's actually kind of sweet.

55.speaker: Minsc
55.text: You hear that, Boo? We fight alongside a Wychlaran again.
55.context: NodeContext: Utterly unconcerned by the "fool" part, quietly excited by the "Jaheira fights alongside us again" part

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I suppose there is some twisted logic at play there.

52.speaker: Jaheira
52.text: Is there? Wonderful. Another Minsc in the making.

5.speaker: Minsc
5.text: Hah! Not without a companion, I'm afraid. Boo will ask some of his sewer-dwelling friends!
5.context: NodeContext: Snorting, not unkindly, at the notion that the player is like Minsc. Obviously they need a Boo-equivalent first

6.speaker: Player
6.text: So what you're saying is you've learned absolutely nothing.

49.speaker: Jaheira
49.text: Well, at least you're getting to know him a little better.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I don't care what you call yourselves. I just need you both focused on the fight ahead.

37.speaker: Jaheira
37.text: I am your friend, ranger, I am not your witch. There will be no ointments, or healing balms.

2.speaker: Jaheira
2.text: You know better than to believe our victory is some destined thing. I need to be sure that Minsc knows it, too.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Speaking of feelings - does Minsc know you were ready to kill the Emperor for him?

31.speaker: Jaheira
31.text: ...My own foolishness does not absolve Minsc of his.

18.speaker: Jaheira
18.text: A sad and desperate bluff. I need to be sure that Minsc understands I cannot make such a threat twice.

33.speaker: Minsc
33.text: I have already pledged my sword and hamster both. What more does Minsc have to give?

38.speaker: Jaheira
38.text: Your word, ranger - that next time, you will stop and think. I will not always be here to tell you what to do.

41.speaker: Minsc
41.text: If not here, then where? Wherever there is, Minsc and Boo will go too! My hamster... he would not be parted from you again, Jaheira.
41.context: NodeContext: Heavy emphasis on 'there' in second phrase. Jaheira has suggested she won't be around forever - Minsc won't hear of it. The last is the closest he gets to sincerely telling her how much he missed her.

16.speaker: Jaheira
16.text: ...I missed him, too. And try as you might, I know you have not missed my point as neatly as you pretend.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: She's right, Minsc. I need to know you'll follow orders from here on out.
